cultural_etiquette: Dress modestly when visiting temples like Mangueshi.
Always ask for permission before taking photos of locals on the beach.
important_tips: Keep a digital copy of your driving license for scooter rentals.
Avoid swimming at Anjuna Beach near the rocks; currents are strong.

accommodation.booking_tip: Book a 'Superior Dorm' for extra locker space.
accommodation.name: The Hosteller Goa, Anjuna
accommodation.why_this: Social atmosphere, budget-friendly dorms, and walking distance to the beach.

activities.description: Walk through the lanes of the iconic hippie market area. Even on non-market days, the shops sell bohemian jewelry, tapestries, and leather goods.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Anjuna Flea Market, Anjuna, Goa, India
activities.local_secret: Check out the small silver jewelry stalls in the back lanes for 30% cheaper prices than the main road.
activities.tips: Haggle hard; start at 50% of the quoted price.
activities.why_this_fits: Since you love the beach vibe, this area captures the authentic 70s hippie soul of Goa.

activities.description: A Mediterranean-style cafe set in an old Portuguese house. Famous for its hummus platters and vibrant garden seating.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Artjuna Garden Café, Anjuna, Goa, India
activities.how_to_reach: Walk 5 min from market area (0.4 km)
activities.local_secret: Try the 'Artjuna Thali'—it's the most filling meal for the price.
activities.tips: The ginger-lemon-honey tea is great for hydration.
activities.why_this_fits: Perfect budget-friendly spot for a healthy lunch before a long day of exploring.

activities.description: Known as the 'Temple of Trance,' this beach shack transforms into a neon-lit party hub as the sun sets.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Shiva Valley, Anjuna Beach, Goa, India
activities.local_secret: The chai shop right outside the entrance serves the best late-night snacks for under ₹100.
activities.tips: Entry is usually free before 8 PM; drinks are reasonably priced.
activities.why_this_fits: Matches your party interest perfectly with its world-famous Tuesday night trance sessions.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Healthy lunch followed by exploring the rocky shores of Anjuna Beach.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Humid; wear breathable linen and carry a reusable water bottle.
itinerary.evening_summary: Experience the legendary sunset party at a beachside shack.
itinerary.morning_summary: Arrive in Anjuna and settle into your hostel before heading to the cliffs.

accommodation.booking_tip: Use the hostel's common area to meet fellow solo travelers for the party.
accommodation.name: The Hosteller Goa, Anjuna
accommodation.why_this: Central location between Anjuna and Vagator party spots.

activities.description: A 17th-century laterite fort offering stunning views of Vagator Beach and the Arabian Sea.
activities.local_secret: Walk to the far north corner of the ramparts for a view of Morjim beach across the river.
activities.tips: Wear shoes with grip; the climb is short but slippery.
activities.why_this_fits: Iconic 'Beach' viewpoint and a great spot for photography.

activities.description: A local favorite famous for its authentic and affordable Goan Fish Thali.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Vinayak Family Restaurant, Assagao, Goa, India
activities.local_secret: Order the 'Special Fish Thali'—it includes 3 types of seafood preparations.
activities.tips: Reach by 12:15 PM to avoid the 30-minute lunch queue.
activities.why_this_fits: Best budget meal in North Goa to fuel your party night.

activities.description: A high-energy bar overlooking the Ozran cliffs with excellent music and a sophisticated crowd.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Titlie Culinary Bar, Vagator, Goa, India
activities.local_secret: The 'Small Plates' menu is more affordable and better for sharing than main courses.
activities.tips: Cover charge usually applies after 9 PM; arrive early.
activities.why_this_fits: Perfect for your 'Party' interest with a great mix of house music and views.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Authentic Goan Thali lunch followed by a swim at Ozran Beach.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Sun is harsh at the fort; carry a hat and sunscreen.
itinerary.evening_summary: Sunset cocktails at a cliffside lounge followed by clubbing.
itinerary.morning_summary: Hike up to the 'Dil Chahta Hai' fort for panoramic ocean views.

accommodation.booking_tip: Check out by 11 AM to avoid late fees.
accommodation.name: The Hosteller Goa, Anjuna
accommodation.why_this: Hostel allows luggage storage after checkout.

activities.description: Enjoy a combo of parasailing, jet skiing, and banana boat rides.
activities.local_secret: Walk 500m north of the main Baga entrance for shorter queues and better prices.
activities.tips: Negotiate a 'combo pack' for all 3 sports to save ₹300.

activities.description: A colorful market selling authentic Himalayan artifacts, jewelry, and clothing.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Tibetan Market, Baga Road, Goa, India
activities.how_to_reach: Walk 5 min from Baga Beach (0.3 km)
activities.local_secret: The singing bowls here are genuine; test them with the wooden mallet before buying.
activities.tips: Check for the '925' stamp on silver jewelry to ensure quality.

activities.description: A trendy yet affordable restaurant known for its massive seafood platters and Goan vibes.
activities.local_secret: The 'Prawn Curry Rice' is the most authentic dish on the menu.
activities.tips: Try the Bebinca for dessert—it's a traditional Goan layer cake.
activities.why_this_fits: High-quality food at a mid-range price point.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Last-minute souvenir shopping at the Tibetan Market.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Expect sea spray; keep electronics in waterproof bags.
itinerary.evening_summary: Early dinner at a beach shack before boarding the bus to Mumbai.
itinerary.morning_summary: Adrenaline-pumping water sports at Baga Beach.
itinerary.notes: Return scooter by 5 PM before heading to the bus station.

money_saving_hacks: Drink local King's beer (₹60) instead of imported brands (₹250).
Use the hostel kitchen for breakfast to save ₹200 daily.
overall_vibe: You will trade Mumbai's concrete jungle for the swaying palms of North Goa. Expect salty hair, sun-kissed skin, and neon-lit dance floors as you explore the most iconic party hubs on a backpacker's budget.
packing_tips: Power bank for long scooter navigation days.
Earplugs if staying in a party hostel dorm.
smart_insights: Rent a scooter at Mapusa bus stand to save ₹800 on taxi fares to Anjuna.
Entry to most beach shacks is free; pay only for food and drinks.

travel_between_cities.tips: Carry a light blanket; even non-AC buses get chilly at night.

travel_between_cities.booking: Book via Zingbus app for discounts.
travel_between_cities.tips: Board from Mapusa to avoid the Panjim traffic crawl.

trip_title: Goa Budget Blast: Sun, Sand & Neon Nights
validation_warnings: Some activities may have generic names (e.g.: Chapora Fort, Vinayak Family Restaurant, Tibetan Market, Baga). For more specific recommendations, try providing more detailed preferences.
Note: Individual day costs sum to ₹11,000, which differs from the stated total of ₹15,000. Transport between cities may account for this difference.
